form.description: Select the set of spatial regions to be used as inputs for quantitative spatial analysis.

clustering.title: Cell Type Clustering
clustering.description: The first step of quantiative spatial analysis is unsupervised (leiden) clustering of cells to group by feature abundances

resolution.description: Used as the resolution parameter for Leiden clustering. Higher values lead to more clusters.
resolution.title: Cell Type Clustering Resolution

filter_features.title: Filter Features
filter_features.description: Select the set of feature measurements to be used for clustering cells (comma-delimited list).

neighborhood_analysis.title: Neighborhood Analysis
neighborhood_analysis.description: The second step of quantitative spatial analysis is to identify 'neighborhoods' -- physically contiguous collections of cells which have similar distributions of cell types (using the clusters identified earlier).

n_neighbors.description: When performing neighborhood analysis, the number of closest neighbors to consider for each point.
n_neighbors.title: Number of Neighbors

n_neighborhoods.description: When performing k-means clustering for neighborhood analysis, the number of neighborhoods to find.
n_neighborhoods.title: Number of Neighborhoods (k)

use_dashboards.title: If the input data was generated with the dashboard option enabled, create interactive visualizations for inspection of each region. Note that this may be prohibitively resource intensive for very large datasets.
